message.content: This question requires some knowledge about how birds adapt to their environment and find water. In arid places where there are no puddles, lakes, or rainfall, birds have to be resourceful. Option (A), poking a tough plant, refers to the behavior of certain birds that know how to extract water from the moist parts of cacti or other desert plants. They use their beaks to poke into the plant and access the water stored inside. Option (B), eating a small stone, is incorrect because eating a stone will not provide the bird with water. Option (C), taking out a loan, is a play on words and not related to the topic of birds finding water. Option (D), crying for a minute, is also incorrect as crying does not help a bird find water in an arid environment.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the adaptive behaviors of birds in arid environments. In arid places where there is a lack of puddles, lakes, or rainfall, birds have been observed to poke at tough plants. This behavior is done to release the water stored inside the plants, allowing the bird to access the water it needs to survive. Option (B) is incorrect because eating a small stone does not provide water to the bird. Option (C) is nonsensical and not related to the behavior of birds in finding water. Option (D) is also incorrect as crying for a minute does not help the bird find water.
